intro: Eschscholzia cucullata, commonly known as the Pacific poppy, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and a slender, branched stem. Eschscholzia cucullata is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
